title: What are the chances of Vladimir Putin rebuilding and reforming the USSR? What would the appetite of this be among Russians? - Quora

There is zero chance that Vladimir Putin will rebuild the Soviet Union. I make this bold assertion for two reasons. The first reason is that contemporary Russia simply isn’t attractive enough, wealthy enough, or powerful enough to act as a geopolitical magnet for post-Soviet countries. Russia’s neighbors tend to want to leave Russia’s sphere of influence rather than become immersed in it. Over Putin’s two decades in power, Russia has gradually lost influence in Georgia, Ukraine, Moldova, Azerbaijan, and arguably even in Kazakhstan and Belarus. The three Baltic countries are long gone as well. The gains Russia made in the small regions of Crimea, Donbass, South Ossetia and Abkhazia pale in comparison to the huge losses in influence Russia has suffered across much of the post-Soviet space. Russia simply has not offered an attractive political model, and it cannot compete culturally and economically with the West and with China. Moreover, most neighboring countries are very apprehensive after the events in Georgia in 2008 and Ukraine in 2014. The second reason why Putin will not rebuild the USSR is that Russia lacks the kind of strong political ideology the Soviet Union promoted. Putin is not at all a communist, and communism is a marginal political movement in Russia. There are aspects of nostalgia for the Soviet past, but very little appetite for returning to communism. Russians also are more nationalistic than they used to be. The easiest countries for Russia to re-integrate would arguably be the poorer Central Asian countries like Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan. There is very little appetite for such a reintegration within Russia. Russians by and large would like to reunite with nations that are ethnically and culturally similar to Russia, but not with ones that are seen as different and perhaps less developed. In that sense very few people in Russia and in the Russian government are interested in restoring the USSR, geographically or ideologically.
